alert.note: Alert for Kinney; Maverick; Val Verde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 12 at 6:38PM CDT until May 12 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kinney County in south central Texas... Northern Maverick County in south central Texas... Southeastern Val Verde County in south central Texas... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 637 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 14 miles south of Del Rio to 17 miles northwest of Normandy to 9 miles west of Quemado, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Del Rio, Brackettville, Spofford, Quemado, Darling, Amanda, Laughlin AFB, Val Verde Park, Anacacho, Standart, Alamo Village, Normandy, Paloma, Laughlin AFB Aux Field, Turkey Mountain, Fort Clark Springs, Escondido Estates and Kickapoo Cavern State Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging winds, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
